p: From every cultivar where collected about 2 kg of fruits and divided into three parts to replicate the analyses. After harvest, the clean fruits were kept in refrigerator at −20 °C until their extraction. Every sample of berries was chopped using a blender at low speed and the essential oil samples were obtained from the chopped berries by hydrodistillation for 4 h using a Clevenger-type apparatus. For every selection three extractions were performed. The extraction yields calculated as g·kg −1 of fresh material are reported in Figure 1. The oils were stored in sealed vials, at −20 °C, ready for the chemical analysis.
